intro: Hanguana malayana var. anthelminthica, commonly known as the Malayan antifilarial plant, is a flowering shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes. Its medicinal significance lies in its potential antifilarial properties, attributed to compounds found in its leaves and stems. It is traditionally used in local medicine for treating parasitic infections.
